intro: Dichapetalum lokanduense, commonly known as the Lokandu rosewood, is a rare and unique plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has a thick, woody stem and is known for its aromatic leaves, which emit a pleasant scent. Its flowers are clustered in panicles and are pollinated primarily by insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dichapetalum lokanduense is considered a vulnerable species.
